column2: Executive, Corp Security, Board Member, Corp Spy, Analyst, Bureaucrat, Lobbyist, Operations Chief, Liaison
column4: Rank 1–10; each level increases access to company resources (funds, assets, teams), command over personnel, and ability to leverage corporate privileges. Progression unlocks larger budgets, classified projects, direct access to high-level execs, and inter-corporate influence. See Special Notes for caps and scaling.
column5: Business, Persuasion, Social, Negotiation, Bureaucracy, Leadership, Accounting, Intimidate, Awareness/Notice, INT, COOL, EMP
column6: Cross-link: gear/asset tracker tables (corporate vehicles, secure comms, encrypted terminals, high-tier offices, personal staff, security teams, project budgets, asset lists in corp_asset_tracker.tsv)
column7: Cross-link: corp_npc_templates.tsv (junior exec, senior exec, security chief, internal auditor, corp spy, board member)
column8: Junior Staff, Analyst, Section Chief, VP, Senior VP, Board Member, CEO/COO/President; advancement by tenure, deals, coups, rep, and success in power plays
column9: Cross-link: corporations_table.tsv (Arasaka, Militech, Petrochem, IEC, EBM, Orbital Air, etc.), corpo_brokers_table.tsv
column10: Access to classified data, off-books funds, project greenlights, black ops authorization, private security, legal teams, offworld/extraterritorial offices, crisis response, rapid travel
column11: Internal politics, hostile takeovers, sabotage, asset theft, legal/corp wars, backstabbing, demotion, scapegoating, information leaks, burnout, external investigations
column12: Deals closed, projects finished, assets secured or acquired, successful sabotage/espionage, promotions, crises resolved, power grabs
column13: Cross-link: corporate_jobs.tsv (hostile acquisition, espionage, blackmail, project lead, internal audit, policy overhaul), corp_scenario_generator.tsv
column14: COOL + Leadership or Intimidate for personnel command; INT + Business/Bureaucracy for project management; Persuasion/Negotiation for deals; Awareness/Notice for ops security
column15: Corporate Resources is the Corporate’s special ability (1–10); each point represents access to larger budgets, greater teams, classified data, project clearance, and rapid leverage over company assets. Low ranks (1–3): minor budget, small teams, departmental resources. Mid (4–7): cross-departmental power, direct orders to security or R&D, access to classified info. High (8–10): board-level access, authorizing black ops, reshaping policy, initiating/ending corp wars. Edge cases: Resources limited by role, loyalty, and current politics; corporate infighting, audits, or rivalries can restrict use. Inter-corp actions (wars, sabotage, alliances) are managed at higher ranks, often requiring asset and personnel juggling (cross-link corp_war_timeline.tsv and corporate_relationships_matrix.tsv). For disputes, see Corpbooks for clarification and escalation rules.
column16: cyberpunk2020_corebook.pdf p.37, 58–61; Corporate Report 2020 Vol 1–3 (Corpbooks I–III); Maximum Metal p.9–14, 22–29, 34–40; see uploaded corp supplements and tables","",0,false,Markdown
